intro: Paepalanthus clausenii, commonly known as the Clausen's puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
